p: Global warming is also projected to significantly alter climate in the Caribbean region. End of century projections include increases in annual land and ocean surface temperatures of 1.0 to 3.5°C; changes in annual rainfall ranging between approximately −50 and +13.7% and mean sea level rise of up to 1.4m [ 4, 9– 12]. Projected changes in daily rainfall extremes from a number of different studies are summarized in Fig 1. Most of the studies use various downscaling mechanisms to better capture intra-regional variations in climate (i.e. as opposed to using global circulation models), including a high resolution global circulation model [ 11], regional climate models [ 4, 13], a weather generator [ 14] and statistical models from a hybrid of stochastic and regression approaches [ 15].
